alert.note: Alert for Coryell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 5:25AM CDT until further notice by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Texas, including the following counties, Bell, Coryell, Falls, Freestone, Hill, Leon, Limestone, McLennan, Milam and Robertson. * WHEN...Until 830 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Killeen, Waco, Temple, Copperas Cove, Harker Heights, Belton, Hewitt, Robinson, Bellmead, Woodway, Mexia, Lacy-Lakeview, Marlin, Rockdale, Cameron, McGregor, Hearne, Groesbeck, Fort Hood and Nolanville.
